episodes.title: Cult Leader David E. Taylor’s Ex-Wife: He Cheated, Abusive, had 100 "Wives”
episodes.description:
Go to https://buyraycon.com/HANNIBALISHUNGRY
 to get 20% off sitewide! Brought to you by Raycon.

In a shocking tell-all, David E. Taylor’s ex-wife and ex-girlfriend have come forward to expose the alleged inner workings of his ministry and personal life. From accusations of forced labor and abuse to claims of a "harem" of 100+ "wives," the details paint a disturbing picture of the self-proclaimed Apostle.

In this video, we delve into the powerful testimonies of Tabitha Taylor and Vicki Yohe. Tabitha Taylor reveals how she was allegedly subjected to physical and emotional abuse. She describes her ex-husband's obsession with authority and his harsh treatment of staff. We also examine the federal indictment that alleges David E. Taylor ran a forced labor and money laundering conspiracy, where followers were coerced into working in call centers for free to solicit millions in donations.

Gospel singer Vicki Yohe, a former girlfriend of David E. Taylor, shares her story of manipulation and control. She claims he used her for her social media platform to promote his book and that she gave his ministry a lot of money, which she now regrets. Yohe also reveals that after she spoke out, over 100 women contacted her, with many claiming they were also in a relationship with Taylor.

This is a story of a hidden cult, the misuse of power, and the brave women who chose to speak out to expose the truth.

Sources:

WTSP: "Kingdom of God Global Church raid prompts David Taylor's ex-partner to speak out"

The News-Herald: "Pastor accused of running his multimillion-dollar Taylor church as a 'cult'"

Riverfront Times: "More on the Alleged Cult That Bought Nelly's Crumbling Mansion"

Department of Justice: "Two Self-Professed Religious Leaders Who Used Physical and Psychological Abuse to Coerce Victims to Solicit Tens of Millions in Donations Federally Charged and Arrested"

FOX 13 Tampa Bay: "Former church worker relieved after federal raids, arrests of church leaders: 'I can't get back that time'"

CBS News Detroit: "2 Michigan ministry leaders accused of running forced labor organization, money laundering scheme"

KPRC2 News: "'This sounds like a cult': Woman describes friend's experience in church at center of FBI raid"

WL News: "David E. Taylor arrested in Durham: facing charges of forced labor & money laundering"

10 Tampa Bay: "Pastor speaks out after arrest of church leaders at the center of federal investigation"

Wikipedia: "Joshua Media Ministries"

episodes.title: CULT Leader “Apostle” David E. Taylor Claims He’s Broke in Court
episodes.description:
🚨 Fake Apostle David E. Taylor claims he’s BROKE in court — after raking in more than $50 million through his ministry. How does a man accused of living in mansions, flying first-class, and running a cult-like empire suddenly need a court-appointed lawyer?

In this video, Hannibal Is Hungry breaks down:
• How Taylor’s ministry allegedly exploited followers with food stamp fraud, sleep deprivation, and cruel punishments.
• The outrageous “Plan B mandate” and cult-like control over victims.
• The hypocrisy of living a $50M lifestyle while crying poor before a federal judge.
• Why this case shows how corruption, greed, and faith can collide in dangerous ways. Click Here to join My Email Newsletter to get updates on the channel & More!: https://shorturl.at/VI3lh
